item.title: Joanie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Joanie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I've learned that you can tell a lot about a person by the way (s)he handles these three things: a rainy day, lost luggage, and tangled Christmas tree lights." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Joanie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut
